intro: Tsoongiodendron odorum, commonly known as the fragrant lily, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China, where it thrives in cool, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its elegant, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often arranged in a rosette pattern. Due to its limited distribution and delicate nature, Tsoongiodendron odorum is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
